message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.SE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as it proposes a new algorithm for Monte Carlo tree search (MCTS) in games and Markov decision processes. It may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as MCTS is a popular technique in reinforcement learning. The paper also discusses the Multi-armed Bandit problem (MAB), which suggests it could belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category. Additionally, the empirical evaluation of the policy suggests it could belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new sampling policy for MCTS, which could also place it in the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
